paragraphs.body: Songs have great significance in the ${link_0} and are widely enjoyed. The most popular ones are folk songs: simple melodies that are easy to follow and appreciate.
paragraphs.text: Songs have great significance in the World of Avatar and are widely enjoyed. The most popular ones are folk songs: simple melodies that are easy to follow and appreciate.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Tho

paragraphs.body: Tho sang this song to pass the time and celebrate having caught ${link_0} for dinner for the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Tho sang this song to pass the time and celebrate having caught Appa for dinner for the tribe.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} sang in an attempt to appease the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Sokka sang in an attempt to appease the badgermoles.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: ${link_0} and ${link_1}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Sokka and Chong

paragraphs.body: Sokka and Chong performed this tune to appease wild badgermoles.
paragraphs.text: Sokka and Chong performed this tune to appease wild badgermoles.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Six-armed Guru ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Six-armed Guru Pathik

paragraphs.body: Guru Pathik performed this song during one of ${link_0}'s hallucinations.
paragraphs.text: Guru Pathik performed this song during one of Aang's hallucinations.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Chong
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Chong

paragraphs.body: Chong performed this song before he met ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: Chong performed this song before he met Team Avatar.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Chong
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Chong

paragraphs.body: Chong performed this song to brighten Sokka's mood, but was unsuccessful.
paragraphs.text: Chong performed this song to brighten Sokka's mood, but was unsuccessful.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} recited the anthem at ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Fire Nation Man recited the anthem at Earth Rumble VI.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Fire Nation Man

paragraphs.body: This song was sung by ${link_0} Man before a fight against ${link_1} at ${link_2}. Although said to be the Fire Nation National Anthem, Fire Nation Man was not actually from the Fire Nation.
paragraphs.text: This song was sung by Fire Nation Man before a fight against The Boulder at Earth Rumble VI. Although said to be the Fire Nation National Anthem, Fire Nation Man was not actually from the Fire Nation.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Iroh

paragraphs.body: Iroh performed this song during one of his music nights to keep ${link_0}'s crew happy. After the defeat of ${link_1} ${link_2}, the song was played once again by Iroh with his ${link_3}.
paragraphs.text: Iroh performed this song during one of his music nights to keep his nephew's crew happy. After the defeat of Phoenix King Ozai, the song was played once again by Iroh with his tsungi horn.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Iroh
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Iroh

paragraphs.body: Iroh sang this song to entertain a ${link_0} and earn ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Iroh sang this song to entertain a passerby and earn money.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} sang the war ballad in memory of his deceased son, ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Iroh sang the war ballad in memory of his deceased son, Lu Ten.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Iroh
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Iroh

paragraphs.body: "Leaves from the Vine" is a popular children's song, and similar to a lullaby in the Fire Nation's vernacular. Iroh sang it in the marketplace of Ba Sing Se to help calm down a crying boy, and later sang it in remembrance of his deceased son, ${link_0}, on the latter's birthday.
paragraphs.text: "Leaves from the Vine" is a popular children's song, and similar to a lullaby in the Fire Nation's vernacular. Iroh sang it in the marketplace of Ba Sing Se to help calm down a crying boy, and later sang it in remembrance of his deceased son, Lu Ten, on the latter's birthday.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Chong
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Chong

paragraphs.body: Chong performed this tune while in the ${link_0} after he shared his idea of singing a love song to escape. It was again played after they found their way out of the cave.
paragraphs.text: Chong performed this tune while in the Cave of Two Lovers after he shared his idea of singing a love song to escape. It was again played after they found their way out of the cave.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Chong and ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Chong and Moku

paragraphs.body: Chong performed this tune to tell the tale of the Cave of Two Lovers and later remembered the forgotten part as "and die!". This song is said to be ${link_0}'s favorite song.
paragraphs.text: Chong performed this tune to tell the tale of the Cave of Two Lovers and later remembered the forgotten part as "and die!". This song is said to be Kya's favorite song.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Toph Beifong

paragraphs.body: This song was performed by Toph as she proceeded to coat her clothes in a "protective layer" of dirt.
paragraphs.text: This song was performed by Toph as she proceeded to coat her clothes in a "protective layer" of dirt.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} sang old ${link_1} songs in an attempt to calm down the evacuees of ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: Pema sang old airbender songs in an attempt to calm down the evacuees of Republic City.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Pema

paragraphs.body: Pema performed this tune in an attempt to amuse the bored and impatient evacuees while they waited for a ${link_0} to leave ${link_1} during the ${link_2}.

links.body: invasion of the United Republic of Nations

paragraphs.text: Pema performed this tune in an attempt to amuse the bored and impatient evacuees while they waited for a train to leave Republic City during the invasion of the United Republic of Nations.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: ${link_0}
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Wu

paragraphs.body: Wu performed this tune to command the badgermoles he had freed from the Republic City Zoo.
paragraphs.text: Wu performed this tune to command the badgermoles he had freed from the Republic City Zoo.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Wu
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Wu

paragraphs.body: Wu performed this tune to make the badgermoles continue digging and to thank Yin for her help.
paragraphs.text: Wu performed this tune to make the badgermoles continue digging and to thank Yin for her help.

paragraphs.body: Performed by: Wu
paragraphs.text: Performed by: Wu

paragraphs.body: Wu performed the first part of the song to order the badgermoles to take down the ${link_0} ${link_1} threatening them and the second part to thank them.
paragraphs.text: Wu performed the first part of the song to order the badgermoles to take down the Earth Empire mecha suits threatening them and the second part to thank them.

source.title: Songs in the World of Avatar
